Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate the material before heating or cooling, showing its original state.
The student can depict the material after heating or cooling, indicating any changes that occurred.
The student can show whether the change can be reversed by illustrating the material returned to its original state, if applicable.
The student can identify in their drawing if the change is irreversible, showing that the material does not return to its original state.
The student can highlight in the drawing the cause of the change, such as heating or cooling.
The student can illustrate a comparison of reversible vs. irreversible changes through examples (e.g., melting ice vs. cooking an egg).
